title: Winter Adventure Weekend
suitableFor: Active couples and experienced friends who enjoy a mix of outdoor adventure and unique experiences, and are comfortable with potentially cold and wet conditions. Must have good base fitness for hiking.
notSuitableFor: Those with mobility issues, severe fear of heights, or who prefer warm-weather holidays. Also, families with young children may find some activities too challenging.

stops.title: Snowdon Summit Hike
stops.description: Take on a guided hike up Snowdon via the Llanberis path. Expect stunning views (weather permitting!) and a challenging but rewarding climb.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh slate industry in a fascinating museum.

budgetAlt.title: Llyn Padarn Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around Llyn Padarn lake with views of Snowdon, completely free.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis serving hearty portions and hot drinks, perfect after a hike.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Peris viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own prepared food with panoramic views of Llyn Peris.

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
stops.description: A comfortable and convenient hostel in Llanberis, ideal for hikers and adventurers.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Pitch your tent at this friendly campsite near Llanberis.

stops.title: Bounce Below
stops.description: Experience the thrill of bouncing on giant trampolines in a vast underground cavern.

wetAlt.title: Underground Adventure
wetAlt.description: Explore a disused slate mine with guided tour

budgetAlt.title: Llechwedd Slate Caverns Tour
budgetAlt.description: Take a more traditional tour of the slate caverns.

stops.title: Underground Adventure
stops.description: Explore a disused slate mine, navigating tunnels and chambers with expert guides.

wetAlt.title: Zip World Caverns
wetAlt.description: Navigate through a network of zip lines, rope bridges and tunnels inside the caverns.

budgetAlt.title: Blaenau Ffestiniog Heritage Railway
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic train ride through the mountains.

stops.title: The Pengwern Arms
stops.description: A traditional pub in Llan Ffestiniog, serving hearty meals and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a packed lunch with stunning views of Llyn Ogwen and Tryfan.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Winter weather in Snowdonia can be unpredictable. Expect cold temperatures, rain, and potentially snow or ice. Check the forecast before you go and be prepared for all conditions.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially on weekends and during school holidays. Allow extra time for travel, especially around Llanberis and Betws-y-Coed. Parking at popular trailheads like Pen-y-Pass fills up quickly, so arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Bounce Below and guided hikes. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance, especially during peak season.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A good level of fitness is required for the Snowdon hike. Be prepared for a long day of walking on uneven terrain. The underground activities require a moderate level of fitness.
